required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Telehealth Technology by Mental Health Care Professionals in Times of COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Telehealth Technology by Mental Health Care Professionals in Times of COVID-19 Pandemic

brief_summary.textblock: A brief online survey to be completed by clinical therapists.

detailed_description.textblock: A brief online survey to be completed by clinical therapists. This brief 28 question online survey asks mental health care providers questions about their use of technology.

primary_outcome.time_frame: measured at the time they take the survey, data collection will continue for up to 1 year.
primary_outcome.description: we are not reporting an overall score on a scale, mostly true false and multiple choice

intervention.description: A brief survey for therapists to fill out

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• Must be 18 years old, and must be a licensed mental healthcare provider actively treating patients within the past year.
Exclusion Criteria:
• Less than 18 years old, or if you are not a licensed mental healthcare provider actively treating patients within the past year.

results_reference.citation: Sampaio M, Navarro Haro MV, Wilks C, De Sousa B, Garcia-Palacios A, Hoffman HG. Spanish-Speaking Therapists Increasingly Switch to Telepsychology During COVID-19: Networked Virtual Reality May Be Next. Telemed J E Health. 2021 Aug;27(8):919-928. doi: 10.1089/tmj.2021.0124. Epub 2021 Jun 28.

Sampaio M, Haro MVN, De Sousa B, Melo WV, Hoffman HG. Therapists Make the Switch to Telepsychology to Safely Continue Treating Their Patients During the COVID-19 Pandemic. Virtual Reality Telepsychology May Be Next. Front Virtual Real. 2021 Jan;1. pii: 576421. doi: 10.3389/frvir.2020.576421. Epub 2021 Jan 15.
